field.note:
Choose the locations in the asset tree from which you want to list events. For each location you can specify a CSS class, or one of the CSS named colours, to use when displaying events from that location. (The CSS named colours are black, blue, fuchsia, gray, green, lime, maroon, navy, olive, purple, red, silver, teal, white and yellow). Events that are linked under several of these event sources will have several CSS classes applied (Note that where there are conflicts between CSS rules the CSS standard dictates that rules defined later in the CSS file will take precedence).

Note that for the default calendar styling to work, you must use a design that uses the Head design area.

section.name: Event Source Restrictions

field.note: If personalisation is enabled, events will only be shown if they are linked somewhere under the current user as well as under one of the locations specified above.
Dynamic event sources only apply when personalisation is disabled

section.note: These event source restrictions do not affect the application of event-source CSS classes (above) or event-source columnisation (see below).

section.name: Settings shared by Week and Day Views

field.note: Consider this as the number of events you expect to normally occur concurrently. If you leave it blank or zero, event widths will be set only according to the number of events actually present. However if you enter a nonzero value, event widths will be set so that there is always room for this number of events to sit side by side, even if fewer than this number of events are actually present
If you choose an asset builder page for this field, users will be able to click on empty cells in the calendar display to go to the asset builder page and add an event for that timeslot
If you enable drag-and-drop editing, users with appropriate access will be able to drag single calendar events and drop them at another point in time.

If the 'other' column is the only column, its default name is 'Events'; otherwise the default is 'Other'. Enter a column name here to override these defaults.
